results.title: Meet me in Las Vegas
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Joe Pasternak and Roy Rowland
results.brief_description: While vacationing in Las Vegas with his mother, a wealthy Nevada rancher meets a ballet dancer who brings him luck at the roulette wheel. Shot on location in the renowned Sands Hotel, the film captures the glitz and glamour of the neon-lit gamblers’ paradise in its martini-era prime and features numerous cameo appearances by famous actors and Las Vegas entertainers including Frank Sinatra, Paul Henreid, Lena Horne, Frankie Laine and Peter Lorre. A song and dance highlight, featuring Cyd Charisse, is the thirteen minute bop parody of the ballad ‘Frankie and Johnny’ with special lyrics by Sammy Cahn sung by Sammy Davis Jr. Other songs include ‘The Gal With The Yaller Shoes’, ‘If You Can’t Dream’, ‘My Lucky Charm’, ‘Hell Hath No Fury’, ‘I Refuse To Rock ‘N Roll’

results.title: Meet John Doe (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Liberty Films and Frank Capra
results.brief_description: In this acclaimed Capra extravaganza, warning against the threat of fascism, Gary Cooper portrays a naive street tramp who becomes the unwitting tool of corrupt politicians. Journalist, Ann Mitchell (Barbara Stanwyck) conveys the story of John Doe, who then becomes the voice of the people and the champion of decency and fair play. Doe threatens suicide as the ultimate protest against corruption; and thousands of good citizens rally to prevent his death. Director Frank Capra weaves touching comedy into this powerful screen masterpiece. Also stars Edward Arnold and Walter Brennan.

results.title: Meet De Sica
results.creator_credit: Santa Lucia Productions, Christopher Leigh-Smith and Bika De Reisner
results.brief_description: An analysis of Vittorio De Sica, as director, actor, man; relaxed and informal, then occupied and businesslike. De Sica himself guides the narrative and introduces interesting sidelights from his intensively creative life. We learn much of De Sica’s ideas and methods from long detailed excerpts of his films, including Bread, Love and Dreams, Shoeshine, Bicycle Thieves, The Bed, Miracle in Milan.

results.title: Meet again after 20 years = Er shi nian hou zai xiang hui
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Film Studio and Xiaohua Shi
results.brief_description:
Hanchun Shipyard’s new project to build a large ship is hampered by the supply shortage of imported welding rods. Director Yuan urged his former classmate engineer Chen Qiming to develop their own welding rods as soon as possible. Ms Zhu Hui, also a former classmate of Yuan, is assigned to be the general supervisor of the ship project. But Zhu refused to accept the offer as she learned that the marine surveyor was her ex boyfriend, Feng who left her as she refused to go abroad with him years ago. Yuan persuaded Zhu to take the job and brought about reforms to the ship plant, which was controversial and severely criticized by some senior workers, including Yuan’s own father. Yuan convinced his colleagues with reason and won their support. At the same time, the Shipyard is able to produce the welding rods with Chen’s research breakthrough. As the ship project comes to an end, Feng is approached by a foreign company who wants Feng to create some trouble for Hanchun Shipyard. Feng refused the bribery and finished his task. In the end, Feng proves that his criticism of the project’s problem, once misunderstood by Ms Zhu and her colleagues, is only for the good of the factory. Before Feng leaves China, Zhu resumes her friendship with Feng.

This film shows Chinese people’s changing idea about the reform launched by Deng Xiaoping in the late 1970s. The film should be understood in the context of the early phase of China’s “open-door” policy when Chinese state-owned enterprises were eager to absorb foreign technology and capital while making their own efforts to technology. (3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: Medusa challenger
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films, Phillip Koch and Steven Elkins
results.brief_description: A flower vendor, Jack, brings his mentally retarded nephew, Joey, to the ten-lane Chicago Lakeshore roadway to help him sell flowers to motorists. In the course of their first day working together, Joey manages to prove himself in difficult and confusing circumstances and gains the loving respect of his uncle. A realistic depiction of mentally retarded person’s abilities. Cast includes Jack Wallace, Joe Mantegna. Written, directed and edited by Steven Elkins.

results.title: Mediterraneo
results.creator_credit: Penta Films, Mario Cecchi Gori, Vittorio Cecchi Gori, Gianni Minervini and Gabriele Salvatores
results.brief_description: A delightful comedy which won an Academy Award for Best Foreign Film in 1992. Eight misfit Italian soldiers are stranded on an idyllic Greek island during World War II. The island is solely populated by women and soon the soldiers are seduced by the beauty of the island and its inhabitants. The ravages and horrors of war are forgotten as the young men embrace a warm and peaceful life. Eventually however, their sojourn in paradise is over and they must confront the end of the war and return to their native land. Italian dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Mediterranean Cookery Egypt,Turkey,Morocco and Greece
results.brief_description: Mediterranean cuisine is one of intense flavours, brilliant colours and simple clean tastes. Attractive, healthy and delicious food reflecting the sun and the sea. A real gourmet’s delight. In this video, Claudia Roden celebrates the exotic cooking of Egypt, Turkey, Morocco and Greece. The culinary diversity of the region is indicated by the wide range of traditional specialities demonstrated by top chefs and talented home cooks. But all the dishes share the characteristic produce of the area: fish straight from the sea, olives and olive oil, grains and pulses, garlic and a myriad of herbs and spices. Here are 23 irresistible recipes to help you recapture the magic of the Mediterranean. Rated: G
